result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald L. Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)3.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.  Defendant shall have no contact with T.A., J.H., R.H., and A.K. without probation's approval.  Defendant shall undergo any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow all treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied. Plea agreement put into the record.  Case No. 14CF80 - defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 2 - possession of drug paraphernalia and count 3 - disorderly conduct-domestic abuse.  14CF82 defendant enters a plea of no contest to the amended charge of Count 1 - conspiracy to manufacture meth (10-50) grams and Count 5 - possession of meth paraphernalia.  Plea freely and knowingly.   Court finds defendant guilty.  Court dismisses and read in remaining counts in 14CF80 and 14CF82 and dismisses and read in Case Nos. 14CF78, 14CM82, 14CM91 and 15CM52.   Statement by victim.  Statement by attorneys.  14CF80 - Court orders court costs on each count; DNA surcharge on Count 2 only; 30 days county jail with good time on Count 3 only; concurrent to 14CF82.  14CF83 court orders count 1 - 5 years initial confinement followed by four years of extended supervision.  Count 5 - 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years extended supervision. Conditions of court costs on each count; DNA sample and surcharge; no contact with T.A.; J.H.; R.H. or A.K.; AODA and follow all treatment recommendations; any other counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; 324 days sentence credit.  Defendant is eligible for CIP/ERP.  - rt

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Bachman appeared in person.  Gerald Pearson appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Tlusty indicated to the court that they have reached an agreement for all of Mr. Pearson's cases.  Judge indicated that he had no objection to the agreement.  Judge indicated that the jury trial for Thursday be taken off of the calendar and will now be a plea and sentencing that day at 10:00 a.m.  Attorney Tlusty voiced her concern regarding the defendant changing his mind.  Mr. Pearson indicated to the court that if he changed his mind he would not get a speedy trial.  Judge indicated to call off the jurors and witnesses.  - rt

Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearings for case numbers 14CF82, 14CF78 and 14CF80.   S.K. sworn and examined.  Detective Aemus Balsis sworn and examined.  Court 14CF78 court finds probable cause that defendant committed a felony.  In 14CF80  court finds probable cause for possession of THC but not count 4 - reckless endangering safety.   In 14CF82 court finds probable cause for the felony charges.  Information filed.  Waive reading of information.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a not guilty plea on all counts.  Brief recess.  Mr. Pearson is waiving his right to a speedy trial for all cases.  Court deems request for speedy trial as withdrawn.  Pretrial conference to be scheduled.  - rt

Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Defendant Gerald L. Pearson in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaints.  Would like a preliminary hearing  within time limits for his felony cases.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for Friday, March 13, 2015.  Defendant stands mute on his pleas for his misdemeanor cases.  Court denies defendant's request to remove Attorney Bachman as counsel.  Court enters not guilty pleas on Mr. Pearson's behalf for the misdemeanor cases. Court orders bond as follows:  Case No. 14CM82 - $500.00 signature bond; booking no contact with T.J.A. dob:  9-9-85.  Case No. 14CM91 $500.00 signature bond; booking; no contact with T.J.A. dob:  9-9-85.  Case No. 14C78 $1,000.00 cash bond; booking; comply with all sex offender registry requirements.  Case No. 14CF80 bond continued with additional no contacts of J.R.H. dob:  6-18-60; R.J.H. dob:  5-5-61 and A.J.J.K. dob:  3-16-95.  Case No. 14CF82 $5,000.00 signature bond; booking; no contact with T.J.A. dob:  9-9-85; no possession or consumption of controlled substances.  No objection to bond by defense.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall have no contact with T.J.A. - dob:  9-9-85.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gerald L. Pearson appeared in court, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $10,000.00 cash bond; booking and no possession or consumption of a controlled substance without a valid prescription and no contact with T.J.A.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is November 4, 2014 at 2:00 p.m.  - rt
